availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married Jane Moorman in Warren County in August 1829. Father of Thomas J. Sweeney, Georgeanna Sweeney, Mary J. Sweeney, William Sweeney, Jesse Sweeney, and Nancy Sweeney. Resident of Warren County in 1830. Owned six enslaved persons in 1830. Resident of Warren County in 1840. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Warren County in1840. Farmer in Warren County in 1850. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Owned Louisa [Unknown] in Warren County in 1852. Owned Wesley [Unknown] in Warren County in 1858. Resident of Warren County in 1864.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film 000164003.
